block.p: The Lennox Lewis-Michael Grant fight on TVKO last Saturday night generated 375,000 pay-per-view purchases, one of the least impressive performances for a heavyweight championship.
The number of purchases were within TVKO's expectations, and confirmed the lack of drawing power of the two fighters.
The Lennox Lewis-Michael Grant fight on TVKO last Saturday night generated 375,000 pay-per-view purchases, one of the least impressive performances for a heavyweight championship.
The number of purchases were within TVKO's expectations, and confirmed the lack of drawing power of the two fighters.
Last November, Lewis's victory over Evander Holyfield to become the undisputed heavyweight champion produced 850,000 pay-per-view buys.
In March, 1999, 1.2 million people bought the first Holyfield-Lewis bout, the eighth most in pay-per-view history.
Three Mike Tyson fights, including the two against Holyfield, were the most successful. The second generated 1.99 million purchases, the first, 1.6 million.
